system.description:
This spell creates a mass of 1,000 cubic feet of stone, which the caster can shape into a variety of solid forms. The created stone is nonmagical and cannot be dispelled.

Shape & Casting Time:

  • A simple shape (wall, block, column) takes 1 round to form.
  • A basic structure (staircase, archway) takes 1 turn (10 minutes).
  • A complex design (statue, ornate fountain) takes up to 12 turns (2 hours).

The object must be a single solid piece with no moving parts. The caster may later use Stoneform to modify an existing creation for up to 2 hours. Once satisfied, the caster can finalize the form with a last casting, preventing further modification.

Restrictions & Properties:

  • The stone must rest on solid ground or similar support.
  • It cannot be formed in an occupied space.
  • Multiple castings can be seamlessly joined together.
  • The caster may choose the type of stone (within reason).
  • It is immune to dispel magic and lasts indefinitely unless physically destroyed.

Durability:

  • Stone walls have an AC of -4 (AC 6 if simplified) and 100 HP per 1' thickness.
  • Most exterior walls are about 7" thick and have 60 HP.
